protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® PCR & DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg) (NEB #T1030)
protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® PCR & DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg) (NEB #T1030)
description: This is the "quick" version of Monarch® PCR & DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg) Protocol (NEB #T1030). For the full protocol, please click here.
before_start:
Add 4 volumes of ethanol (≥ 95%) to one volume of DNA Wash Buffer.
  • For 50-prep kit, add 20 ml of ethanol to 5 ml of Monarch DNA Wash Buffer
  • For 250-prep, kit add 100 ml of ethanol to 25 ml of Monarch DNA Wash Buffer
All centrifugation steps should be carried out at 16,000 x g (~13,000 RPM).

materials.reagent_name: Monarch® PCR & DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg)

keywords: Monarch PCR Cleanup Kit, Monarch DNA cleanup kit
guidelines:
For detailed protocol and more information, visit www.neb.com/T1030

The full protocol is available here.

The video protocol is available here.

components.data:
Dilute sample with DNA Cleanup Binding Buffer according to the table below. Mix well by pipetting up and down or flicking the tube. Do not vortex.  A sample volume of 20–100 μl is recommended. For smaller samples, TE can be used to adjust the volume. For diluted samples larger than 800 μl, load a portion of the sample, proceed with step 2, and then repeat as necessary.
Sample Type Ratio of Binding Buffer: Sample Example
dsDNA > 2 kb (plasmids, gDNA) 2:1 200 μl: 100 μl
dsDNA < 2 kb (some amplicons,  fragments) 5:1 500 μl: 100 μl
ssDNA (cDNA, M13) 7:1 700 μl: 100 μl
components.name: Description

components.data: Insert column into collection tube and load sample onto column. Spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g, then discard flow-through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Insert column into collection tube and load sample onto column. Spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g, then discard flow-through.

components.data: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer (with ethanol added) and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer (with ethanol added) and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional.

components.data: Repeat Step 3. (Step 3: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat Step 3. (Step 3: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional).

components.data: Transfer column to a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer column to a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute.

components.data: Add ≥ 6 μl of DNA Elution Buffer to the center of the matrix. Wait for 1 minute, then spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g to elute the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add ≥ 6 μl of DNA Elution Buffer to the center of the matrix. Wait for 1 minute, then spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g to elute the DNA.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of Quick Protocol for Monarch™ PCR & DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg)
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® PCR & DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg) (NEB #T1030)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® PCR & DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg) (NEB #T1030)
source_data.annotation: Typical elution volumes are 6–20 μl. Nuclease-free water (pH 7–8.5) can also be used to elute the DNA. Yield may slightly increase if a larger volume of DNA Elution Buffer is used, but the DNA will be less concentrated. For larger size DNA (≥ 10 kb), heating the elution buffer to 50°C prior to use can improve yield.
